page.title: 18Interview with a farmer
page.content: I am a dairy farmer and I have lived here for 58 years. I own 42 acres of land and about 3 acres of housing. The main business part is called 'Barns End' but I have a few other buildings. I own five portions of land each a half a mile apart. I also own 50 cows which feed on a small pellet called 'dairy feed' in the winter. The milk they produce I bottle myself. I own 4 tractors and all my own equipment. My 2 sons help me on the farm. A school near here has made me a governor and a chairman. I am a Methodist but as there is only a Church of England near, which has no resident vicar, I attend there. The bus service is not regular so I have a car to get me to town.
